What the White House’s vaccination plan for young kids means for Bay Area

The White House on Wednesday announced plans to roll out the vaccine to children aged 5 to 11, once regulators sign off. That day looks to be coming soon: a key FDA committee is slated to review the matter Tuesday, and the CDC will likely follow suit the first week of November. Here’s what we know, and how Bay Area parents are reacting.
